empty_link_element.what: Element has no visible and accessible name

texts: The link content has only whitespaces. Having only defined an attribute aria-label="Benetech Facebook" is not sufficient and it is recommended to have the content instead, e.g. at least visually hidden, but exposed to assisitve technologies. Some users are disabling styles for better readability, and also description from attribute is not available for automatic translators.

<iframe> elements have an accessible name

title_iframe.what: Element is an iframe or object but its title attribute is missing or empty

texts: Expected title attribute to be defined on iframe. However, if it is an iframe without valuable content for the user then add the attribute aria-hidden="true" in order to hide it from assistive technologies.

Frames must have an accessible name; Element has no title attribute; aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty; aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty; Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

AAA.2_4_1.H64.1.what: iframe element has no non-empty title attribute

texts: Iframe element requires a non-empty title attribute that identifies the frame.

frame_title_exists.what: Inline frame has no title attribute

texts: Inline frame does not have a 'title' attribute

QW-ACT-R19.what: iframe element has no accessible name

texts: The test target accessible name doesn't exist or it's empty ('').

r14.what: Visible label is not in the accessible name

texts: Visible labels are included in accessible names

label-content-name-mismatch.what: Element visible text is not part of its accessible name

texts: Elements must have their visible text as part of their accessible name; Text inside the element is not included in the accessible name

AAA.2_5_3.F96.what: Visible label is not in the accessible name

texts: Accessible name for this element does not contain the visible label text. Check that for user interface components with labels that include text or images of text, the name contains the text that is presented visually.

label_name_visible.what: Accessible name does not match or contain the visible label text
